phrases: Do not worry about the change.
He does not need to buy anything...
Oh, I have to return your gloves.
I will get them for you.
I will collect the gloves another time.
I would like you to keep them.
You do not need an excuse...
The Mistress would be pleased to see you anytime.
No, that is not what I meant...
if you wish to come again...
He wants to know why you are off gallivanting around instead of working.
I leave it in your capable hands, Teresa.
I cannot make excuses for you every day!
Well, it is not as if I want to carry on my father's work.
You should not say things like that.
You are avoiding the subject again!
You sound so pleased to see me.
We ran into him at the station.
Oh, but the country's better in some respects.
But in the country, there are no shops or theatres.
Brother Will, I heard that Harrods has been refurbished.
As I said, some other time.
Some other time never seems to come.
Your father wishes to see you.
It would seem you have turned down every invitation you have received.
Moreover, you have left it to Stevens to pen your regrets.
You are not the one who needs to apologize.
We may not have a title, but do you know why our merchant family receives invitations?
But we must not forget character, intelligence and manners.
Those are the qualities valued by polite society.
The upper class is dependent upon polite society.
That is part of our work too.
You will go to the ball this evening.
I told them you would be there.
It is no use standing there like that, you know.
You should dance with someone at least once.
But to be perfectly honest, it is a bother.
It is been such a long time, Mrs. Campbell!
I was worried because I had not seen you lately.
Yes, I am pleased to say he still has a lot to say for himself.
I knew I should have worn my lace gloves...
You are still going on about that?
She does not like her dress, does not like her hair...
She is been complaining all night.
If you do not mind, would you dance one waltz with her?
Would you do me the honor of a dance, Miss Campbell?
I never would have thought this was your first dance.
They certainly do make a handsome couple.
I will hold this for you!
Do not be a nuisance to Miss Emma!
Honestly, I do not know whether you are helping or hindering...
I recommend the green beans today!
Well then, some green beans please.
Are you sure we should be here with you?
Did not you have something else that you wanted to do?
The three of us have not spent time together for ages.
It is the least I could do.
Eleanor, it is been such a long time!
How fortuitous that we should meet like this.
All fashionable ladies shop at the same stores, you know.
Brother Will, do you know Eleanor?
We met at the ball the other night.
I think they like each other!
No, I just wanted a parasol.
I try to coordinate my parasol with my dress each day, so I am always in need of a new one.
as you can see, some are decorated with lace or ribbons.
And some of the handles are made from ivory or are intricately sculptured.
I admit they are rather lovely.
Would a lady be happy to receive a present like this?
I would like to give this to a lady.
Brother Will's going to buy a present for Eleanor?
I did not mean to imply that...
I did not mean to imply that...
I did not mean to imply that I wanted you to...
I am sorry, for giving you the wrong impression.
Well then, who are you going to give that parasol to, brother?
That is none of your business.
Miss Eleanor, are you sure you did not want to buy a parasol?
I am not interested in a parasol.
That Master William should fall in love at first sight...
But really, Master Arthur is more my type.
His moodiness just drives me wild!
Stop chattering and get on with your work!
She is the housekeeper, she just wants to be bossy!
Emma baked that scone, you know.
Our Young Master is so accustomed to a lavish lifestyle...
I did not mean it like that...!
We have run out of sugar, have we not?
But madam, I have not finished cleaning...
Um, I will go with her!
When The Season begins, there seem to be more people in London.
Actually, my brothers and sisters have just returned from a health resort.
I had to go shopping with my sisters.
I found a parasol that I thought would suit you.
I would be very happy if you use it.
Please do not worry about it.
That may be so for you, but to me it is quite extravagant.
It is not something I could easily afford, even if I worked hard.
I do not mean to be rude.
But, the lace handkerchief I received...
Your smile then, when you accepted the lace handkerchief...
I will not buy any more presents.
Cannot we spend some time together occasionally, like this?
Emma, a pot of tea, please.
You can take that off now.
This is a gift of thanks, for always putting up with me.
I am not a girl anymore, you know!
Well, since it is a gift, I must accept it, I suppose.
Well then, thank you very much.
Does not that woman work for the Jones family?
